elements.name: plus-animation

events.name: plus-cancel
events.description: Fires when the [Animation.cancel()](https://mdn.io/animation-cancel) method is called or when the animation enters the "`idle`" play state from another state.

events.name: plus-finish
events.description: Fires when the animation finishes playing.

events.name: plus-remove
events.description: Fires when the animation is removed (i.e., put into an `active` replace state).

properties.name: composite
properties.description: Determines how values are combined between this animation and other, separate animations that do not specify their own specific composite operation.

properties.name: delay
properties.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: Whether the animation runs forwards (`normal`), backwards (`reverse`), switches direction after each iteration (`alternate`), or runs backwards and switches direction after each iteration (`alternate-reverse`).

properties.name: duration
properties.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete. Keep in mind that your animation will not run if this value is 0.

properties.name: easing
properties.description: The rate of the animation's change over time. Accepts the pre-defined values "`linear`", "`ease`", "`ease-in`", "`ease-out`", and "`ease-in-out`", or a custom "`cubic-bezier`" value like "`cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1)`".

properties.name: endDelay
properties.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the end of an animation. This is primarily of use when sequencing animations based on the end time of another animation.

properties.name: fill
properties.description: Dictates whether the animation's effects should be reflected by the element(s) prior to playing ("`backwards`"), retained after the animation has completed playing ("`forwards`"), or `both`.

properties.name: instance
properties.description: The [Animation](https://mdn.io/api-animation) object instance.

properties.name: iterationComposite
properties.description: Determines how values build from iteration to iteration in this animation. Can be set to `accumulate` or `replace`.

properties.name: iterations
properties.description: The number of times the animation should repeat. And can also take a value of [Infinity](https://mdn.io/infinity) to make it repeat for as long as the element exists.

properties.name: iterationStart
properties.description: Describes at what point in the iteration the animation should start. 0.5 would indicate starting halfway through the first iteration for example, and with this value set, an animation with 2 iterations would end halfway through a third iteration.

properties.name: keyframes
properties.description: A [keyframes](https://mdn.io/keyframe-formats) object or `null`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Specifies what kind of animation will play. The list of available animations is [here](/element/animation/names).

properties.name: playbackRate
properties.description: Sets the animation's playback rate.

properties.name: run
properties.description: Starts the animation.

properties.name: overrides
properties.description: TODO

properties.name: cancel
properties.description: Clears all [keyframeEffects](https://mdn.io/keyframe-effect) caused by this animation and aborts its playback.

properties.name: commitStyles
properties.description: Commits the end styling state of an animation to the element being animated, even after that animation has been removed. It will cause the end styling state to be written to the element being animated, in the form of properties inside a `style` attribute.

properties.name: finish
properties.description: Seeks either end of an animation, depending on whether the animation is playing or reversing.

properties.name: pause
properties.description: Suspends playing of an animation.

properties.name: persist
properties.description: Explicitly persists an animation, when it would otherwise be removed due to the browser's [Automatically removing filling animations](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation#automatically_removing_filling_animations) behavior.

properties.name: play
properties.description: Starts or resumes playing of an animation, or begins the animation again if it previously finished.

properties.name: reverse
properties.description: Reverses playback direction, stopping at the start of the animation. If the animation is finished or unplayed, it will play from end to beginning.

properties.name: updatePlaybackRate
properties.description: Sets the speed of an animation after first synchronizing its playback position.

elements.name: plus-carousel

events.name: plus-destroy
events.description: Runs when the carousel has been destroyed. This only fires once and will be the last event the carousel fires.

events.name: plus-init
events.description: Runs when the carousel mounts for the first time.

events.name: plus-pointer-down
events.description: Runs when the user has a pointer down on the carousel. It's triggered by a `touchstart` or a `mousedown` event.

events.name: plus-pointer-up
events.description: Runs when the user has released the pointer from the carousel. It's triggered by a `touchend` or a `mouseup` event.

events.name: plus-re-init
events.description: TODO

events.name: plus-resize
events.description: Runs when the carousel container or the slide sizes change. It's using [ResizeObserver](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ResizeObserver) under the hood.

events.name: plus-scroll
events.description: Runs when the carousel is scrolling. It might be a good idea to throttle this if you're doing expensive stuff in your callback function.

events.name: plus-select
events.description: Runs when the selected scroll snap changes.

events.name: plus-settle
events.description: Runs when the carousel has settled after scroll has been triggered.

events.name: plus-slide-focus
events.description: Runs when a slide receives focus. For example, when a focusable element like a button, link or input receives focus inside a slide.

events.name: plus-slide-focus-start
events.description: TODO

events.name: plus-slides-changed
events.description: Runs when slides are added to, or removed from the carousel **container**.

events.name: plus-slides-in-view
events.description: Runs when any slide has **entered** or **exited** the viewport.

properties.name: align
properties.description: Align the slides relative to the carousel viewport.

properties.name: autoHeight
properties.description: Enables the height of the carousel container to be adjusted to match the tallest slide in view. This element provides a built-in implementation of Embla's `Auto Height` plugin, so there's no need to include the original plugin manually.

properties.name: axis
properties.description: Choose scroll axis between `x` and `y`.

properties.name: classes
properties.description: Enables automatic class injection for styling based on carousel state. This element provides a built-in implementation of Embla's `Class Names` plugin, so there's no need to include the original plugin manually.

properties.name: containScroll
properties.description: Clear leading and trailing empty space that causes excessive scrolling. Use `trimSnaps` to only use snap points that trigger scrolling or `keepSnaps` to keep them. **Note**: When this is active, it will **override alignments** applied by the **align** property for enough slides at the **start** and the **end** of the carousel, in order to **cover** the **leading** and **trailing space**.

properties.name: draggable
properties.description: Enables scrolling the carousel using mouse and touch interactions.

properties.name: dragThreshold
properties.description: Drag threshold in pixels. This only affects **when** clicks are fired and not. In contrast to other carousel libraries, it will **not affect when dragging** of the carousel **starts**. **Note**: Browsers handle touch events differently than mouse events. Browsers won't fire the click event when a touch event includes an accidental slight swipe gesture. This is why this threshold only works for mouse events.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Set scroll duration when triggered by any of the API methods. Higher numbers enables slower scrolling. Drag interactions are not affected because duration is then determined by the drag force. **Note**: Duration is **not** in milliseconds because Embla uses an attraction physics simulation when scrolling instead of easings. Only values between `20-60` are recommended.

properties.name: focusable
properties.description: Enables automatic focus event watching on slides. When enabled, fires a slideFocus event and scrolls to the focused slide.

properties.name: inViewThreshold
properties.description: This is the Intersection Observer [threshold](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API#creating_an_intersection_observer) option that will be applied to all slides.

properties.name: loop
properties.description: Enables infinite looping by translating slides to create a seamless loop. Automatically disables if slide content is insufficient to prevent glitches.

properties.name: plugins
properties.description: Pass Embla [plugins](https://www.embla-carousel.com/plugins) to extend carousel functionality.

properties.name: mirror
properties.description: Matches the current slide on another carousel using its id.

properties.name: mirrorType
properties.description: Specifies how the carousel should be mirrored onto another carousel.

properties.name: resizable
properties.description: Watches the **container** and **slides** for size changes and runs reInit when any size has changed.

properties.name: slidesToScroll
properties.description: Group slides together. Drag interactions, dot navigation, and previous/next buttons are mapped to group slides into the given number, which has to be an integer. Set it to `auto` if you want to group slides automatically.

properties.name: startIndex
properties.description: Set the initial scroll snap to the given number. First snap index starts at 0. Please note that this is not necessarily equal to the number of slides when used together with the `slidesToScroll` property.

properties.name: tweenFactorBase
properties.description: Sets the base multiplier for the `--plus-carousel-factor-*` CSS variables used in visual transitions. This allows you to create dynamic slide effects such as scaling or fading. For example, setting this value enables effects like: - [Scale](https://www.embla-carousel.com/examples/predefined/#scale) - [Opacity](https://www.embla-carousel.com/examples/predefined/#opacity) The value affects how strongly the visual transformation is applied relative to the slide's position in the carousel.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: Provides a visual style variant for the carousel. Can be used to conditionally apply CSS themes or variants.

properties.name: api
properties.description: The Embla carousel API.

properties.name: overrides
properties.description: TODO: Indicates whether the carousel has been successfully initialized.

properties.name: canScrollNext
properties.description: Check the possibility to scroll to a next snap point. If **loop** property is enabled and the container holds any slides, this will always return `true`.

properties.name: canScrollPrevious
properties.description: Check the possiblity to scroll to a previous snap point. If **loop** property is enabled and the container holds any slides, this will always return `true`.

properties.name: previousScrollSnap
properties.description: Get the index of the previously selected snap point.

properties.name: scrollNext
properties.description: TODO: Resets automatic behavior in the carousel.

properties.name: scrollPrevious
properties.description: Scroll to the previous snap point if possible. When **loop** property is disabled and the carousel has reached the first snap point, this method won't do anything. Set the **jump** parameter to `true` when you want to go to the previous slide instantly.

properties.name: scrollProgress
properties.description: Check how far the carousel has scrolled of its scrollable length from 0 - 1. For example, **0.5 equals 50%**. For example, this can be useful when creating a scroll progress bar.

properties.name: scrollSnapList
properties.description: Get an array containing all the snap point positions. Each position represents how far the carousel needs to progress in order to reach this position.

properties.name: scrollToIndex
properties.description: Scroll to a snap point by its unique index. If **loop** property is enabled, Embla Carousel will choose the closest way to the target snap point. Set the **jump** parameter to `true` when you want to go to the desired slide instantly.

properties.name: selectedScrollSnap
properties.description: Get the index of the selected snap point.

properties.name: slideNodes
properties.description: Get all the slide nodes inside the container. This method can be useful when you need to manipulate the slide elements dynamically or similar.

properties.name: slidesInView
properties.description: Get slide indexes **visible** in the carousel viewport. Honors the [inViewThreshold](https://www.embla-carousel.com/api/options/#inviewthreshold) option.

properties.name: slidesNotInView
properties.description: Get slide indexes **not visible** in the carousel viewport. Honors the [inViewThreshold](https://www.embla-carousel.com/api/options/#inviewthreshold) option.

elements.description: It's the most flexible and powerful grid system which you need to build simple to complex responsive layouts, using two main elements, `plus-grid` as a container & `plus-grid-item`. By using these elements, align your content in any form & shape and for all screen sizes with 12 available column sizes and 6 breakpoints.

properties.name: alignSelf
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid). It overrides the align-items property of its parent.

properties.name: alignSelfXs
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for extra-small display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified. (It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for extra-small breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfSm
properties.description: Aligns the grid-item vertically in its container (grid) for small display sizes. It also applies to larger breakpoints and display sizes while they are not specified. (It overrides the align-items property of its parent just for small breakpoints).

properties.name: alignSelfXl

elements.name: plus-intersection

events.name: plus-change
events.description: Fires When the browser detects that the element has been unveiled or obscured.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Disables the element functionality.

properties.name: once
properties.description: The event fires only once.

properties.name: root
properties.description: The element that is used as the viewport for checking visibility of the target. Must be the ancestor of the target. Defaults to the browser viewport if not specified or if `null`.

properties.name: rootMargin
properties.description: Margin around the root. Can have values similar to the CSS [margin](https://mdn.io/margin) property, e.g. `"10px 20px 30px 40px"` (top, right, bottom, left). The values can be percentages. This set of values serves to grow or shrink each side of the root element's bounding box before computing intersections. Defaults to all zeros.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: Either a single number or an array of numbers which indicate at what percentage of the target's visibility the observer's callback should be executed. If you only want to detect when visibility passes the 50% mark, you can use a value of 0.5. If you want the callback to run every time visibility passes another 25%, you would specify the array [0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1]. The default is 0 (meaning as soon as even one pixel is visible, the callback will be run). A value of 1.0 means that the threshold isn't considered passed until every pixel is visible.

properties.description: TODO
